title: List of all Android physics  libraries for use in your project
meta: See collection of all Android physics  libraries, filter by license, modified date, languages, and select best for your usecase.

repoList.name: Physics-Animations-Demo
repoList.description: A demo app using Android's dynamic animation support library APIs.

repoList.name: Physics-Arkanoid
repoList.description: Half-built Android game utilizing JBox2D libraries for physics.

repoList.name: SimulationEngineLibrary
repoList.description: A small custom OpenGL ES based 3D graphics and physics framework primarily intended to be used in Chemistry and Chemical Process simulation projects on Android

repoList.name: coinman-android-game
repoList.description: An android game using a 2D physics library (libGDX) and Java.

repoList.name: Air-Hockey-2d-Android
repoList.description: Air Hockey 2D Android Game using core vector drawing, without using any 3rd party libraries.

repoList.name: Modifiable-Flappy-Bird-Android-Clone
repoList.description: A Flappy Bird Clone for Android that relies on the Gdx library and is designed to be easily modifiable. Changing the physics of the game is as easy as changing a few numbers.

repoList.name: Android_FlappyBird
repoList.description: this demonstrating utilizing the LibGDX Library and simple physics for velocity, gravity, as well as collision detection it multiple states from start to game over. update: This also shows scrolling background as we split the background into image sized segments that are repositioned every frame, thus create the illusion of a game level.

repoList.name: BoatInPond
repoList.description: Basic boat simulation application for Android written in pure Java. No external physics or graphics (or any other) libraries are used.
